title: What is it like to kill someone intentionally? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is it like to kill someone intentionally? For me? Irritating. I spend my life doing as little as possible, and the act of killing someone is so monumentally work producing that the very idea that I have to go through so much effort to cover up the crime, and dispose of the body and ensure that no one finds out, all just to avoid prison is just so much work. So, intentionally killing someone? It’s an irritating hassle, I don’t feel like going through all of the effort of making sure I don’t get caught, and if I do get caught then it’s an even bigger more irritating and perhaps worst of all: boring experience of going to prison. I don’t like my time being wasted and I don’t like being bored. Killing someone produces a monumental amount of my time being wasted and risks the ultimate form of boredom (sitting in a concrete box with nothing to do). Beyond that I don’t really feel anything about it one way or another. You might as well be asking “what is it like to intentionally break a pencil?” Well, you snap the pencil and then you clean up the dust. Hopefully you didn’t get any splinters, that would be irritating.

Well, it can’t be generalized easily, everyone has a specific reason to commit whatever action on their choice. Killing someone intentionally is not a simple decision of course, it takes more than accumulative reasons of certain period that would trigger the intention. And if you said intentionally, that means it takes planning to manifest the action, and the consideration, and it’s gonna involve the thoughts about the risks of the action, and courage, it’s not a simple one as everyone would take this decision against the knowledge of he / she has also the survival sense that supposed to be in everyone else, then decide to break this. I believe it’s not easy decision for whoever and whatever they are, and I hope you wouldn’t have this intention.
